greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = largest prime less than the smallest prime dividing n (or 1 if there is no such prime).
comment: a(n) = 1 if and only if n is even or if n = 1.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: 5 is the smallest prime dividing 35. So a(35) is the largest prime < 5, which is 3.
mathematica: a[n_] := If[EvenQ[n], 1, Prime[PrimePi[FactorInteger[n][[1]][[1]]] - 1]]; Table[a[n], {n, 2, 80}] (* _Stefan Steinerberger_, Mar 14 2006 *)
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Mar 10 2006
ext: More terms from _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Aug 29 2006
